website_summaries.verdict: A large, sturdy window box that comes at a bargain price.
pros: An excellent value and great quality
Users report their boxes don't fade, even when exposed to daily sun
cons: If you want to wall-mount it below your window ledge, you'll have to buy brackets separately

customer_reviews.title: How about some Pizzazz for our front bay windows...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of the 36-inch Countryside Flower Box Planters to liven up our bay windows. Hopefully this helps out and does the trick! Planters are made from durable plastic and each have two pre-drilled holes in the bottom for drainage. The Pancea aluminum brackets were used for mounting and had to be ordered separately as the window boxes do not come with anything to mount. All in all, we're very satisfied with this purchase. As far as durability, I'll have to monitor to see how they hold up during the change of seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Royal3ok

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for outdoor use: shattered into a thousand pieces
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these in June 2016 (2 years and 5 months ago). I recently noticed that one of them has a crack in it. I ordered two more, just to be on the safe side, and today went to transfer my plants from the 2-year-old planters to the new planters. As soon as I touched them, the 2-year-old planters shattered into a thousand pieces. I swept up the dirt and put my plants into the new planters, for now, but I will be looking for replacement planters ASAP. These planters are NOT suitable for use outside. Or possibly for anything other than very temporary use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Blackmoor

customer_reviews.title: It's a planter
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what it looks like, a cheap white planter, and is doing exactly what I expected a cheap white planter to do
customer_reviews.author: Ovid Boyd

customer_reviews.title: I can always depend on Amazon  !
customer_reviews.text: Received today, packed very secure. Planted my daffodils in my 30 inch resin planter today also. The planter holds it shape and is pretty strong . I added small rocks inside bottom of planter for additional drainage and the dirt and rocks and water and flowers never changed the shape of planter. I have submitted a picture and in the picture you will see a white resin loveseat bench in the background. This was delivered from Amazon 2 weeks ago. I am extremely happy with the look. It is still a little cool here in Ohio, but I just could not wait to dress my front porch for spring. Thankyou Amazon. I owe it all to you.
customer_reviews.author: marie

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Does Not Maintain It's Shape
customer_reviews.text: Someday I'll learn that a low price often reflects quality and not necessarily a good deal. I purchased this 36" window box and it immediately began bowing (warping) when I put the dirt in it. That should have been my first clue that the plastic was not sturdy enough to keep it's shape. I am now searching for a new planter that will maintain it's shape as it should be designed to do. Bad choice on my part.
customer_reviews.author: RayRayJ

customer_reviews.title: Suits my needs!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. It's working perfectly to house my pumpkin plant indoors until it's replanted to the garden. I have it on my window ledge and it looks great there.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: NOT as advertised ....see photos.
customer_reviews.text: absolutely useless...I odered an 18 inch length so I could dip my 18" squeegee in it when window washing...The photos show this is not 18" .... It is a royal pain to return because I live in Mexico. So I am stuck with it. I have zero use for it. Why would a seller advertise a product as 18" when it is clearly not?? Returning is not an option , more trouble than its worth.
customer_reviews.author: splash1234

customer_reviews.title: Too long, handles won't attach to prevent bowing out.
customer_reviews.text: Boxes drain very poorly, handles to keep Center walls together do not attach without breaking attachable ends. Soul makes the middle how out. The product isn't sturdy enough - I bought 5 of six, planted happily but when I watered well, ugh! I had to drill more holes in the sides and it still drains too slowly if it gets flooded. Not recommended at 36" ..
customer_reviews.author: Susan Waller

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. It's a sturdy plastic but very lightweight, perfect for my third floor window where I don't have to worry about it falling and breaking into pieces. There is one drainage hold in the middle of the planter but you can easily create more drainage holes yourself. I don't have a drill or anything fancy to cut holes out, so I used a switchblade to cut an X into two of the already shaped circles on the bottom of the planter and then I pushed it out with a pair of scissors and circled around the hole and it gave me two perfect circles! Super easy! See picture.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy junk.
customer_reviews.text: This pathetic planter box will likely find its way to the landfill in a year or two. Made out of flimsy plastic it lacks enough support to hold itself together without bulging out at the sides. I’m embarrassed that I not only wasted good money on this product, but also contributed to our wasteful culture. I don’t have a problem with sturdy plastic pots and boxes, but this kind of junk should be avoided.
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Good size box
customer_reviews.text: There was a little bracket that was supposed to hook to both sides that was meant to hold the middle together because the plastic is too lightweight to support the dirt towards the middle. I put the bracket on, and it (bracket) immediately broke. Since the box was already full of dirt, and the seedlings were planted, I couldn't return it. I did however really like the sage color, and the fact that the box is light to carry. And I bought a matching tray. It was very difficult for me to find a box that fit my windowsill, so this ended up working out for me
customer_reviews.author: Lorene S

customer_reviews.title: Not as Sturdy as Hoped
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent value for the money, but I was hoping it would be sturdier. It comes with a little plastic piece to hold the sides together in the center to support them, but that plastic piece keeps popping out. I use another potted plant to hold up the sides, since without the support they bow out a lot. It also could use a few more drain holes - I wish I'd realized that before I planted my vegetables, but I'll drill a few more holes before next season. It's not a terrible purchase and the beans don't seem to mind too much, but it needs a few refinements before being a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Deck Planters
customer_reviews.text: Both this and the 36" planter boxes fill the need for an attractive, inexpensive place for growing. Ours sit on the deck and after drilling another couple of drainage holes in the bottoms, have performed flawlessly. They were never meant to be hung however, no matter what the claims are! The weight of the soil alone bows out the middles and I can't imagine they'd last more than a day if you tried to hang them up by the fragile upper lip. Of note: We painted ours with our outdoor deck paint to match the deck, and after 6 weeks of hot sun, wild storms, etc., the paint is still adhering perfectly. In case you want a different color!
customer_reviews.author: Antique Lover

customer_reviews.title: Planter information was misleading
customer_reviews.text: 18 inch planter has only one drainage hole in the middle, needs to have a drainage hole at each end. It would be possible to drill more holes. The true color is not the same sage color as in the picture, The true color is more olive green. Knowing this will help to make a more informed decision. This planter is sturdy and can be useful.
customer_reviews.author: bg

customer_reviews.title: Hope to have for a few years as the white against a dark green fence just pops and looks beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: This served my purpose, however it was a little bend on one of the corners when it arrived, but still usable. Could be a little fragile than what I expected it, but you just have to be careful with it. Hope to have for a few years as the white against a dark green fence just pops and looks beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: M. Aponte

customer_reviews.title: Could use a few small updates, but glad to have it
customer_reviews.text: This is nice on our shed window, I put it in slightly off level, wish it had a back piece to screw in and THEN one can put support on the bottom. However it looks beautiful this summer, 1 star off for the drain hole, I put cheesecloth as we did not want dirt coming through, but cloth held water, I had to push metal rod up the hole to relieve and water only now coming out.
customer_reviews.author: Pappy

customer_reviews.title: Good Planter For Affordability; Beautiful Unleavened White
customer_reviews.text: This is a good planter. It definitely holds fine if you aren't careless. It has an extra plastic piece to help hold the middle together. It's not particularly strong, but neither is it worthlessly flimsy like some people seem to be saying. It's like laundry-basket strength. It's a good planter that's relatively affordable for a 3-foot planter, and its color is beautiful, unleavened white.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Larger than expected which works great, I bought green to blend with the plants. There is a handle (or whatever that was) that comes with it which is useless, broke the second I tried to attach it to the box. I didn't expect a handle? so it doesn't matter but if parts are included, simple instructions or a sturdy handle would be nice. The plastic is medium thickness, doesn't bend as you carry it full of soil.
customer_reviews.author: mayka06851

customer_reviews.title: Terracotta is only the color of the Planter...
customer_reviews.text: My wife isn't too keen on plastic pots, doesn't really matter how sturdy or light weight they are - they don't breath the way an actual "Clay Terracotta" planter would. She was excited to find them on line, but when they arrived they were "Terracotta" colored plastic planters we could have bought locally.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J.

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment!
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy; not up to the lowest gardening standards. It comes with a bracket to try and keep the center from bowing; it doesn’t work! Very sorry I purchased this! Not even worth half the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flower box
customer_reviews.text: I like these. They are just as they are described. I wish I had gone with a bit larger than 18 inches, as that's a bit smaller than I pictured in my head, but that's to no fault of the seller. I LOVE that these are made in the USA and are of recyclable plastic!
customer_reviews.author: ALLFLUKSD

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This planter is exactly what I was looking for to plant our onion sets in. I drilled a few holes in the lower side, added the potting/planting soil, 100 onion sets to start with, watered the plants and waited for the growing to begin. We will have fresh green onions for our 4th of July gathering. I will be buying another one for next season, can't have too many green onions. This is our first attempt at having plants in containers rather than the ground, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: redrumpres

customer_reviews.title: Edges are not the strongest and bend out when full ...
customer_reviews.text: Edges are not the strongest and bend out when full with soil. I added a metal brace across the middle to compensate. Could use some additional support on the inside of the product or brace that runs through the midsection (below soil of course)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bradford

customer_reviews.title: Economical solution
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I dislike (and others may like it) is that the inside bottom has several ridges along it that prevent pots from sitting level on them. I'd planned to set several pots in the larger planter, using it as a more finished 'drip tray' but the pots all tip in different directions.
customer_reviews.author: Nurch

customer_reviews.title: Nice planter boxes for a deck.
customer_reviews.text: Nice planter boxes for my deck. I sunk them into the top of my deck wall to replace a 20+ year old handmade planter. They are sturdy enough for this type of application, bit I'm not sure how stiff they would be in a free standing arrangement - the flexibility of the plastic walls makes me somewhat suspect. which is why I rated sturdiness with 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bob M.

customer_reviews.title: Received scratched up
customer_reviews.text: When opening the box then item looked great except one side has black scratch marks in 3 or 4 places and a brown spot mark. Too much of a hassle to go through a return and wait to get another one. Fortunately I can turn the marks to the back side but definitely overpriced for the quality and the damages.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Chica

customer_reviews.title: Thin, but holds plants
customer_reviews.text: Great size, and they look great on my porch. The support in the center didn't really do much for me, it kept popping out. Once filled with dirt and plants it bows a little bit in the center. The plastic is thin, so I expected that. Haven't had them for too long, so I can't speak to longevity, but so far I like them.
customer_reviews.author: amber

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy! Defective valves!
customer_reviews.text: Has a huge defect where one of the valves does not close completely, no matter how much you tighten it. It leaked and completely saturated the area I had it sit on. Regret purchasing it and am returning it due to its major defect.
customer_reviews.author: Love2Analyze

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This flower box was much more reasonably priced than many I had seen. It is not the heaviest weight one; but it is substantial enough, especially when soil is added. The sage is a nice outdoor color that blends well into my garden space.
customer_reviews.author: BonitaS

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to any front porch
customer_reviews.text: I love these planters!! They are so much better that what the previous owners had on the front porch rails. They had the ones with the straw in them so every time we had a storm either we had to go find my flowers because they blew out or we had to sweep up a mess because the bottom fell out, but these are perfect!! They are very nice with 2 drain plugs in the bottom and light weight but don't blow off with the wind because the rubber mulch keeps them weighted (I have fake flowers in mine so no dirt needed).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: These planter boxes give my house exactly the look I wanted. I had searched but couldn't finding anything within 150 miles of my home that matched my needs, so I turned to Amazon. The product vinyl is sturdy, and the planters are just the right size. They have a channel for drainage and plant health. I did have to buy some brackets, but they were readily available locally. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lou

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Can't use cocoa liners anymore at my back porch deck to plant in my haystacks. The wasps used them to nest! Wanted something to replace the liners I had to throw away. These are perfect, fit well and look great. Will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia R.

customer_reviews.title: Water water everywhere
customer_reviews.text: If I could get my little plants to write a review it would be: we weren't sure if these new boxes would fit our lifestyle, after getting some potting soil and settling in we moved our little roots around and then came the water. It was wonderful. The smell from the moist soil was intoxicating. We all enjoy the boxes - except Vinney. He's never happy.
customer_reviews.author: SuperRog

customer_reviews.title: Good plastic planter
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I thought this was ceramic (probably read the description too fast). It still works great for the wildflowers I planted. It fits our deck railing almost exactly and had held up to summer heat/sun great.
customer_reviews.author: L. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I am doing a vertical wall garden and I didn't want it to go to the floor. I needed something that was long enough and not heavy because I was mounting it to catch the extra water. This product is perfect in weight and length. And it also came in the color I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: TRB

customer_reviews.title: Countryside Flower Box 36" Terracotta colored plastic container
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you cannot go wrong. I ordered two for winter cemetery arrangements for display in front of a 42" headstone and they are great. A little lighter than I expected but a few bricks rectified that. Otherwise totally satisfied and I would purchase them again!
customer_reviews.author: Carpathianne

customer_reviews.title: Quite Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, this is a pretty flimsy planter. Jist the pressure of the potting soil bows out the sides. I definitely wouldn't store it outside in cold winters as it will likely crack or even shatter very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen McBrair

customer_reviews.title: Okay planter but plugs tend to leak.
customer_reviews.text: This plant is just okay. It comes two rubber drain plugs to keep water from weeping. However, the drain plugs tend to weep letting out some water. Again, ok product but don't expect it to keep water.
customer_reviews.author: Brycer

customer_reviews.title: Good Sized Planter
customer_reviews.text: Very nice planter, light weight yet good sized with drainage holes. I knew I did not want a terra-cotta planter when I purchased it and easily spray painted it a different color. I have seen similar planters for less money since I received this planter.
customer_reviews.author: singingcat

customer_reviews.title: Nice planter boxes
customer_reviews.text: I chose these plastic planter boxes as inserts for the cedar boxes I built to complement our outdoor space. I thought they were reasonably priced and well constructed. They came in multiple lengths which made box construction much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Penny R

customer_reviews.title: I bought these along with 3 standard window box brackets for each box and they have held up great and look awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant with some of the reviews to purchase this item as a window box. However, I really could not couldn't see myself spending any more for a simple window box (some of them are ridiculously expensive). I bought these along with 3 standard window box brackets for each box and they have held up great and look awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren R.

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be fine
customer_reviews.text: I just planted impatiens in the box, and it has not had much time yet, but seems fine. I liked the holes in the bottom to release a little water. The last one warped after a summer (could have been two summers actually), but for the price, this one is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Boschen

customer_reviews.title: Good planter for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Vet nice for the price, but the color was lighter than was reflected in ad. Nevertheless I would buy a couple more since it does enhance my front lawn area. It was larger than I expected, which was great! I did not use on the railing just placed on stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: They finally fixed a huge problem with these very long planters. It comes with a plastic piece that you can put in the middle that keeps it from gaping open. Something so simple but yet works so well.
customer_reviews.author: marcy fuller

customer_reviews.title: Pretty white planter
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I had looked all over for white planters this exact length. No stores in the area had anything in white. Also could not find any on line in white other than here in Amazon. Definitely would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Cori

customer_reviews.title: Good temporary windows box until something heavier comes along.
customer_reviews.text: Size and color I was looking for. Light weight is a disappointment. Wish the company would make a heavy duty version. The light weight disintegrates after five years under UV sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: John in Asheville

customer_reviews.title: Very pretty flowerboxes
customer_reviews.text: We had to replace our 5 flower boxes, it's hard to find the exact fit for what size our brackets are, but these were the closest we could find. So far they have been holding up nice and still look pretty and bright white.
customer_reviews.author: Anita B

customer_reviews.title: ok
customer_reviews.text: I can see how people say this bent on them.. i used for fake flowers but put rocks and such at the bottom.. it definitely warped a bit but not too bad. it's lightweight before you add other items. but it looks nice overall especially from street view
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Outdoor herb planter
customer_reviews.text: I really like that this planter has the plug for drainage and is made in the USA. This is used outdoors for my small herb garden and has held up fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: ILikeBubbleTea

customer_reviews.title: Indecent flower bed but don't forget to take out the ...
customer_reviews.text: Indecent flower bed but don't forget to take out the little black plugs for the drainage. There are only two small drainage holes and so drainage is a challenge. But otherwise very pleased
customer_reviews.author: o deam

customer_reviews.title: great for growing water plants
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these as a drainage hole is optional and that's exactly what I was looking for to grow water plants, lilies and lotus. It's holding the water, stones and soil and my lotus are up and growing.
customer_reviews.author: A reader, a crafter, a gardener and cookTop Contributor: Aquascaping

customer_reviews.title: nicely made flower box planters
customer_reviews.text: My husband searched for nicely made flower box planters, only finding cheap plastic ones that bent. We were happy to take a chance ordering these and they are very nicely made. Hopefully will last for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A Vitulli

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: It's a better combination between less quality high price. In stores similar of this product with better quality and 50% less price. Not recomendable
customer_reviews.author: Mario Lembergier

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made, thin plastic bows and bulges
customer_reviews.text: *edit These are so flimsy once soil is added. The handles to prevent bowing are useless as the tabs break as soon as you insert them (due to the bowing) Hopefully they can be recycled. Please avoid these. In addition they each came unnecessarily individually wrapped in huge clear plastic bags.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Decent but pricy
customer_reviews.text: Decent product I felt the price was high considering it’s thin plastic construction.
customer_reviews.author: Manoj

customer_reviews.title: Exact match
customer_reviews.text: Exact match to others we had. Probably more expensive than the others bought at a local store, but so much easier than shopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for your money! I have order a total of 8 already. They fit great in a planter boxes my husband made for me. They are sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: WK

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the standard plastic bought in the store. Hold up in heat and weather. Don't crack. Good year after year.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: This is made of cheap plastic and should not be mounted on wall
customer_reviews.text: I mounted this outside my tool shed window and the cheap plastic started losing form and started sagging. This is more for plastic flower with no soil/water to hold inside.
customer_reviews.author: Ash P

customer_reviews.title: Overcharged
customer_reviews.text: These are inexpensive and it shows. You get what you pay for. Additionally, the order total came to $38.08 and I was charged $45.13!! Not overly upset about the planters, but livid about the overcharge. Check your bank statements if you order these.
customer_reviews.author: Water Girl

customer_reviews.title: These solved our problem
customer_reviews.text: We put them at the top of the stairs that lead to the deck surrounding the pool. We planted plans that grow downward and they improve the outside appearance of the steps
customer_reviews.author: George W. Burgoon

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: The planters looked and fit the description provided by the seller. However, they were a bit unstable and structurally weak if they were filled within 2 inches of the top with soil.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE... a waste... five x $18.00 each makes my purchase a wAsh. 201-788-5355
customer_reviews.text: These flower rectangular boxes were terrible. Just today I threw them out... would have been too much of a nuisance to return them they bulged in the middle and couldn’t hold the pressure of soil and plantings.... truly the first disappointment I’ve had with my Amazon orders.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Pricing
customer_reviews.text: I was shopping around for these at Home Depot, Low's and Ace hardware stores and they arranged from $3.20 to $4.86 more per pot. What a deal, now I will shop on line and forget the running around.
customer_reviews.author: Louise

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: These are great! They come with a plastic brace to keep the center narrow. Of course, I broke one, but that’s my fault. All is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mara

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Nice but much longer than I needed so had to return.....(stupid me didn’t measure correctly)
customer_reviews.author: Light

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN THE USA!
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my window boxes. I would certainly order again from this company. I knew what I was buying, and they are exactly the way I pictured them to be. Price is right also! As far as the sturdiness, I knew they were plastic, but by the time you fill them with dirt and flowers, they are perfect. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Great Price
customer_reviews.text: The flower box planter is perfect for annuals and perennials on the deck. I ordered 3. They are the perfect size for my rain lilies and succulents.
customer_reviews.author: DomoKaiju

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't come with tray
customer_reviews.text: OK plastic quality. But it doesn't come with tray. I had to buy it separately. A little too expensive
customer_reviews.author: derek

customer_reviews.title: Picture is deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy made. Very high price for a thin piece of plastic. Bowed in the middle she dirt added.
customer_reviews.author: Tdmans1031

customer_reviews.title: Countryside flower box planter
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for a speedy delivery the product arrived in good condition. I was very pleased with the product and will refer it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: Planter Box
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time. Light weight. Good price. There are 2 punch hole drains in bottom which are great.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Y.

customer_reviews.title: BEST PRICE
customer_reviews.text: THE BOXES LOOK NICE BUT WHEN YOU ADD THE SOIL IT BOWS OUT IN THE MIDDLE. I'M GOING TO DRILL A COUPLE OF HOLES AND PUT A THROUGH BOLT IN THE MIDDLE TO HOLD IT STRAIGHT.
customer_reviews.author: fred mould

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not 18"
customer_reviews.text: It's cute, but not 18"... it's barely 17" on the outside measurement. It also had a very annoying sticker at the top, not underneath wear it could be hidden.
customer_reviews.author: Rose B

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP PLASTIC
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic. I ended up repotting my plants because it looked terrible. Now it's in storage and probably going to charity.
customer_reviews.author: Fran Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good trough but a little flimsy (flexes). Only 1 drain hole, so added 2 more.
customer_reviews.author: D MOORE

customer_reviews.title: Good product, great price
customer_reviews.text: I use it, not for flowers or plants, but to catch air conditioner condensate run-off, which had been dripping onto my carpet and seeping into the apartment below. It's attractive, seems sturdy, and does not leak.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Durable but easy to carry
customer_reviews.text: I had 6 of these to plant my garden seeds in the house. Easy for me to carry them outside. Stored them for use next season. All my seedlings did well in these.
customer_reviews.author: Xxxxxx

customer_reviews.title: As Advertised  . . .
customer_reviews.text: Arrived intact, study enough for my indoor window project. Planted and one week later sprouts are now flourishing. . that's all wanted and needed. Win-Win.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Would be better if the plastic was a bit heavier
customer_reviews.text: It quickly expanded in the middle with some heavy rainfall, despite using the included bar. Would be better if the plastic was a bit heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Come with Tray, Despite What One of the Images Shows
customer_reviews.text: Seems okay for indoor use but one of the product images show the planter with a tray, which is why I purchased it. The trays are sold separately, for around $12 each. Also, there is only one drainage hole. This would be find for a round pot, but a long planter like this should have at least two. Looks like I'll probably have to drill a couple of holes.
customer_reviews.author: Shakes the Clown

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I was worried it would be too deep, but my plants are doing really well, so it worked out. You just need to buy enough dirt, and maybe rocks to line the bottom. I also like this color.
customer_reviews.author: Anna B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Price.
customer_reviews.text: For the price you pay the quality is very good. Looks good, I love the color I bought. For me I used the planter for veggies. Gourmet Lettuce, Spinach, and Beets. It has worked real well for me. Many people will want to use the box planter for flowers. I haven't experienced a winter with the planter, but has held up all summer. I would buy this planter again.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Really nice boxes
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product nice and sturdy. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: The real deal

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and fake looking
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and flimsy. I filled it with dirt and it started to bend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well constructed container but drains slow due to having only 1 drainage hole not recommended for succulents and cactis unless you really have gritty well drained mix but overall makes it a good drought tolerant container.
customer_reviews.author: Fou Phanh

customer_reviews.title: Needs drain
customer_reviews.text: I forgot to check. Thought it was the kind with a built in drainage system. This only has a hole in the middle of the bottom, so you'd have to put something under it.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Brack

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These look great on my front porch. They do tend to bow in the middle. I planted 3 small plants. But overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Patti H.

customer_reviews.title: Really Nice Planter
customer_reviews.text: I've owned them for nearly a year, There starting to warp a little bit, but there good planters for the money. Just don't expect them to last for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin Ramos

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought four if these for my patio and love when. Light weight, easy to move around the patio
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: not real sturdy and over priced for what you get
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased better for less money in the past
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great little window planter for my little cactuses and succulents
customer_reviews.author: Derek Dauma and Brianne Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I used these indoors to make Christmas decorations for my plant shelves. They worked out perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Ann G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Well made, looks great, and has good drainage. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: Kinda flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy. I purchased this plastic window box to replace a wooden one that finally deteriorated after years of weather. The plastic is thin and bends easily. It does include drainage holes on the bottom. It may end up being the liner to a wooden window box I will have to build myself.
customer_reviews.author: farmboyWI

customer_reviews.title: Growing space
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to try a small porch vegetable garden. Two of these fit the available space, and provide a welcoming home to a nice crop of sugar snap peas. The easily removable drain plugs make moisture maintenance a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: BobM1952

customer_reviews.title: They serve a purpose and serve it well
customer_reviews.text: They are plastic flower boxes. They work well for what we need them for (set dressing) but do not look too charming up close. Very durable plastic and shaped well. We like them very much.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy, returned it
customer_reviews.text: This window box was very flimsy, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Book Diva

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but...
customer_reviews.text: looks good but I sa2 the same for less at Lowes. It is as described
customer_reviews.author: Fp morgan

customer_reviews.title: Wish they had holes for draining
customer_reviews.text: I've come home to my plants swimming in water after the rain not realizing they are no drainage holes in these. I will have to make some. Otherwise, they seem decent.
customer_reviews.author: Reneé

product_meta.title: Countryside Flower Box Planter, White, 36-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:36-Inch| Color:WhiteConstructed from a superior plastic blend, the Countryside Flower Box features a timeless design with a matte finish. The purposeful ridged layers ensure ruggedness and sustainability. These versatile planters can be placed on flower box brackets under windows, on porches and decks, or along walkways. Built-in feet provide proper airflow and reduce the chance of water pooling under the planter. Suitable for indoor or outdoor use. When using outdoors, remove rubber stopper on the bottom of the planter for proper water drainage. Countryside Flower Boxes are lightweight, UV-resistant, recyclable, and proudly made in the USA. Dims: 36" x 8"x 6.5" (L"xW"xH") Soil Capacity*: 13.9 quarts *Soil capacity measured in dry quarts, one inch from top of planter For best results and to sustain healthy plants in a Countryside Flower Box Planter: • When using outdoors, prior to planting, invert container and remove rubber stopper. Store rubber stopper in safe place to use at the end of growing season. Removing the stopper will allow water to properly drain from the Countryside planter. For additional soil aeration, add a soil amendment such a perlite, small stones, or clay pieces to the bottom—and up to 1/3—of the container. • When deciding what to grow in the flower box, check the planting instructions for the specific plant species. Follow the directions and, if planting multiple seeds or seedlings, place each plant the recommended distance between each plant to allow enough space between them to grow • Position the flower box in an area that will receive the recommended amount of sunlight per the plant’s instructions • Add potting mix to fill the container up to 1" from the top • Water accordingly and often, especially in mid-to-late summer, high-temperature months. • Although the Countryside Flower Box Planter is frost proof and can survive the winter, to promote longevity of the containers, we recommend moving plants and containers indoors. Either insert rubber stopper on the bottom of the planter and grow your plants indoors; or empty the flower box of any residual water or dirt, clean with warm soapy water and store in dry area.
feature_bullets: Classic design with a natural matte finish
Constructed from lightweight, fade-resistant, super tough plastic
Includes removable drainage plugs and built-in feet
Suitable for outdoor or indoor use
